Start the HNG to Activate the VeNB Configuration

Once the HNG configuration is added to the PW EMS, the HNG must be started or a switchover must be performed if it is operational already.

  1. (Option 1) If the HNG is configured, but not operational, start the HNG.
  2. (Option 2) If the HNG and NETCONF settings are configured on the PW EMS after an HNG is running, configured, and connected to the PW EMS, perform an HA switchover on the HNG.
  3. Verify on the HNG that a NETCONF session is active between the HNG and PW EMS by using the show cli session list command.
Once the HNG is operational, it sends the Virtual eNodeB (VeNB) profile configuration (containing the "zone venb-zone" and venb instance) to the PW EMS so that LTE services can be supported by sending its configuration inventory of devices to the PW EMS.
Go to the Configure Devices section to configure the vBBU and vNodes.
